content:
Diagnosis:	Hepatocellular carcinoma

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Segment 6 liver resection

Histology:	Moderately differentiated hepatocellular carcinoma, 4.2cm diameter, T2N0M0, R0 resection with clear margins. Beta-catenin mutation detected.

Current Situation:	Post-operative review

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent liver resection. He has made an excellent recovery from surgery with minimal post-operative pain, now managed with paracetamol only. His wound has healed well and surgical clips were removed today. His appetite has improved and he reports returning to normal activity levels. His latest blood tests show liver function tests returning to baseline and AFP has dropped from 800 to 120.

On examination, his wound is clean and healing well. Abdomen is soft and non-tender with no evidence of ascites. Performance status is 0.

I have discussed surveillance plans with [redacted name]. We will arrange 3-monthly AFP measurements and liver MRI scans for the first two years. His first surveillance scan is booked for June 2024. He will be reviewed in clinic with these results.
